titleStmt.title: A gallant speech spoken by His Highnesse James Duke of Yorke to Englands renowned generall, His Excellency Sir Thomas Fairfax, at the Kings Majesties royall conrt [sic] at Causam. Together, with His Excellencies answer to the said speech, concerning the Kings Majesty, and his royall posterity. Also the chiefe heads of the armies new declaration concerning the King, Parliament, and kingdome. With a message from the generall to the citizens of London.
titleStmt.author: Sanders, William, fl. 1647.
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.
Fairfax, Thomas Fairfax, Baron, 1612-1671.

publicationStmt.publisher: By John Harris?] for Edward Benington, for the publike use of Great Britain,

notesStmt.note: A letter, dated and signed at end: Redding 22 of July 1647. William Sanders.

The imprint is false. "A catchpenny London piece, .. No such printer as E. Benington is known at Oxford or London"--Madan. "This appears to be one of the pamphlets printed by John Harris, .. and to which he added names that cannot be identified as stationers"--Plomer.
Bound between sigs. B and C of Thomason Tract E.399[36].
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
